Dear Ms. Hinton:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 08/23/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and MISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12310 Initial evaluation.
(2) The report shall include the dates and places of
contacts and persons interviewed or observed.
Two of three evaluations reviewed did not contain all contacts of
person interviewed or observed/all social work contacts related
to the initial evaluation. The worker listed contacts on a log, did
not transfer all to the evaluation.
R 400.12310 Initial evaluation. (3) The report shall be an assessment of
all of the following
(3) The report shall be an assessment of all of the
following:
(a) Visits at the residence of the foster home applicants
for observations of, and interviews with, each member of
the household to determine all of the following:
(i) Marital and family status and history, including
current and past level of family functioning and
relationships and any incidents of domestic violence.
(ii) Educational history and any special skills and
interests.
(x) Strengths and weaknesses of each member of the
household.
(xi) Experiences with own parents and any history of
out-of-home care.
Two of three evaluations reviewed did not show consistent or all
elements of information related to the applicant’s social history,

relationships, special interest and skills, or whether they
experienced any out of home placements.
Additionally, the evaluations reviewed did not consistently
indicate both strengths and weaknesses related to household
members and or children of the applicant.
Technical assistance provided related to
R400.124310(3)(viii).

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2021 Renewal Inspection where it
received the following rule violations:
• R400.12311 (1) Foster parent/agency agreement.
4

The agency was successful with that corrective action plan.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator report dated 8/1/2022 was received. Areas reviewed as a part
of that report related to the citation listed above.
Interviews
The chief administrator participated in the entrance conference and exit conference.
Two (Licensing worker and the supervisor) of the agency’s four staff for this program
were on leave of absence during this inspection. The chief administrator and program
manager were interviewed. A review and discussion around violations found and
general consultation was the focus of the exit conference.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
